alert.note: Alert for Crittenden (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 5:14PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, including the following county, Crittenden. Portions of North Mississippi, including the following counties, DeSoto, Tate and Tunica. Portions of West Tennessee, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southaven, West Memphis, Horn Lake, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Walls, Tunica, Lake Cormorant, Eudora, Lynchburg, Robinsonville, Southwest Memphis, Phillipp, Whitehaven, Downtown Memphis, North Tunica, Midtown Memphis, Frayser, Glover and Newport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
